name: Perils of ... Bear George
description:
Perils Of... Bear George or simply Bear George is a game with a side view perspective with fixed screens. It is composed by three different stages and scenarios. It has a family environment in the sense that it can be played mostly by children but also by people with many different ages and a friendly tone presented by a colourful cartoon style. It has some educational aspects because it illustrates symbolically the process of hibernation in bears.

The main goal of this game is to make Bear George fill his belly of apples and conduct him safely to his lair so he can peacefully hibernate for the harsh winter.

At the first stage George will have to swallow the more apples he can. There are three waves of different falling apples (greens, yellows, reds) at this stage. They fall from the trees and he has to be at the right position just with his mouth open to be able to catch and swallow them. Pay attention to the dangerous squirrels at the top of the trees which will throw heavy nuts at George's head, delaying his task of storing food, they are unpredictable. Beware too not to make George a glutton, because unexpected things can happen if he becomes too fat. The more apples he'll swallow, the more heavy, fat and slow he gets.

After this initial stage, independently of the amount of apples George was able to store, it's time for him to get home and hibernate. Leaving the forest George will have to go through the snow passageway which leads him to the cave where he lives. A frantic skier is constantly crossing George's path so he has to be aware not to be knocked out.

Inside the cave where he lives, there are humongous spiders blocking his path. A contact with these spiders will put George directly at the initial stage with less a life. When succeeding crossing this dangerous cave, he is finally able to hibernate until March where Spring comes.

Controls menu.
Changing keys.
Starting the game.
George has to swallow the many apples he can (but not too many) so he gets fat for his hibernation. The 1st round of apples are green.
Apples fall randomly from the trees and George has uses his mouth to swallow them. The 2nd ground, yellow ones.
And the 3rd round... red apples.
But beware that there are some things that fall from the trees that are indigestible. See that yellow ugly bastard onthe top of the right tree? It's a squirrel from Hell.
Poor George is so concentrated in filling his belly he doesn't even have the time to reflect what is about to enter his mouth.
Told you George, don't thrust in squirrels, specially from Hell.
Now George more apple than a bear, has generated so many levels of fat I wonder if he gets diabetes...
The last bite. I thought I was about to hear a special tune at the end (look at the scale bellow indicating the amount of gathered food).
George is no more, I mean, pieces of George are getting stuck in the branches of the lovely trees. Poor George was so gluttonous he busted the scale, just for the music.
What was left of our George was his poor skinny skeleton (am I feeling some kind of lecture here?).
But because this is a cartoon game, bit by bit George recollected his scattered pieces and repeated the process of storing food, but without greediness this time. It's about time to go back home.
- Whazzzup?
(undecipherable)
Our buffeted George is so tired he don't even realizes there are new guests in his lair.
Forget about the giant spiders, they aren't edible and besides you already have enough fat for the hibernation.
Home sweet home. Rest George, you deserve it.
Hibernation process takes months because of harsh winters. It's a survival process for George to get fat.
Spring is coming, it's time to stretch those furry legs and get moving.
